description: The Toyota Camry (/ˈkæmri/; Japanese: トヨタ・カムリ Toyota Kamuri) is an automobile sold internationally by the Japanese auto manufacturer Toyota since 1982
image: spanning multiple generations. Originally compact in size (narrow-body)
__v: the Camry has grown since the 1990s to fit the mid-size classification (wide-body)—although the two widths co-existed in that decade. Since the release of the wide-bodied versions
column6: Camry has been extolled by Toyota as the firm's second \"world car\" after the Corolla. As of 2022[update]
column7: the Camry is positioned above the Corolla and below the Avalon or Crown in several markets.\n
